DB Tables



dom_properties

Holds property/value pairs used by the system. Most used: locked = early used to break the ant setup-db if value=true ( useful to protect accidental run of ant setup-db on live databases ) cvs-revision = the application version the dbschema is compatible with svc_ds_id = the name of the database service used in applicaiton to connect to the current database


Column Definition Description
name VARCHAR, 30
pk_properties_name
PRIMARY KEY
 The name of the property.
value VARCHAR, 200
 The value of the property.

dom_customer

Contains information about one customer. Beside common customer data like name, country, language etc, it provides information about billing strategy and some configuration data ( robinson list, bounces, messages and others )


  • constraint: name:fk_cust_region_ref_id
    references:
    in dom_auth_region.regionid for regionid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
customerid NUMBER, 10
pk_customer
PRIMARY KEY
 unique identifier of the customer
version NUMBER, 7
 Version number starting at 1, that is always increased by one whenever for that customer: * the customer-settings are modified, * a domain is added or modified, * the customer-wide permissions are modified and * the meta-data change.
shortname VARCHAR, 20
 lower-case name for the customer not used by the application but by some admin-tools
name VARCHAR, 100
 name of the customer
ip_range VARCHAR, 4000
 allowed IP ranges
bounce_period NUMBER, 4
check_customer_bounce_per
CHECK
 Number of days after which bounced members are automatically deleted ( see table dom_group_bounce_settings ) or reactivated acc. to their bounce category. -1 means this feature is switched off
f_billing_required BOOLEAN, 0 - F_IS_BILLABLE of every new group is set to 0 1 - F_IS_BILLABLE of every new group is set to 1
f_billing_per_piece BOOLEAN, 0 - billing for mailout will be calculated using the byte volume of the sendout 1 - billing for mailout will be calculated using the number of sent emails
billing_size_threshold NUMBER, 10
 Used for billing calculations, to determine a threshold of the message size determining the billing algorithm to be used. This value is used when billing for mailout is calculated using the number of mails sent; if the average size of emails sent is bigger than this value the big-email-price is used for billing, else the small-email-price is used ( this values exists in dom_billing_price.subject - see also in code BillingSubject.MAIL_OUT_PIECE_BIG and BillingSubject.MAIL_OUT_PIECE_SMALL )
max_msg_size NUMBER, 10
 Maximum size (in bytes) allowed for emails sent to this customer's users. {User:05_01} {User:05_01.3.44} It defaults to 500kb. If the message is bigger as this limit an Exception is thrown.
default_iso_language VARCHAR, 2
chck_customer_def_isolang
CHECK
 Must point to a corresponding entry in DOM_CUSTOMER_DOMAIN
default_iso_country VARCHAR, 2
chck_cust_def_isocountry
CHECK
 Must point to a corresponding entry in DOM_CUSTOMER_DOMAIN
bookperiod NUMBER, 3
 Bookmarking is a feature for reserving user for campaingns ( the user should not receive in the last ... days more then ... emails ). default value for DOM_USER_EXT_?.BOOKPERIOD, when a user is created for this customer; -1 disables the default
bookmaxemailcount NUMBER, 3
 default value for DOM_USER_EXT_?.BOOKMAXEMAILCOUNT, when a user is created for this customer; -1 disables the default
destination CHAR, 1
check_customer_destinatio
CHECK
 Used only by administrators, to determine if the customer is an intern one ( i ) like test systems, etc. or customer ( c ). Used for administration task; not used by application.
f_verify_addresses BOOLEAN, See in dom_user.f_email_verified. true if user email addresses and mobile numbers are to be verified
f_web_read_as_single_rcpt BOOLEAN, True if web reads should count as single recipients.
creation_date TIMESTAMP, timestamp when customer has been inserted in table
application_cluster NUMBER, 3
 Used by administration to run two clusters ( on two different version, during migration ) connected to the same database. Toggeling between 0 and 1 depending on which cluster this customer is running. Used by customer dao to retrieve information about which application_cluster a customer is running on.
robinson_list VARCHAR, 500
 Configuration reference to core.xml for robinson list (i.e. external blacklist). The setting refers to a provider configured in the robinson list service section of core.xml. This provider is used determine whether a user should be skipped on sendout. The setting is can either be a simple provider id, or a URI with this syntax: rolist://[/][?query]
robinson_list_add VARCHAR, 500
 Configuration reference to core.xml for robinson list (i.e. external blacklist). The setting refers to a provider configured in the robinson list service section of core.xml. This provider is used when add email addresses is added to a robinson list. The setting is can either be a simple provider id, or a URI with this syntax: rolist://[/][?query]
sysname VARCHAR, 20
 NOT USED BY APPLICATION! Normally corresponds to the sysname of the default domain of this customer.
alarm_email VARCHAR, 129
 Alarm emails contains error logs ( by imports, etc. ) which should immediately be reported. Often here stays an PM email. email-address for alarm messages to be sent to
status CHAR, 1
 Encodes the current status of the customer in it's life cycle (currently only used for deleting bulk data of customers marked for deletion) a i - the customer is inactive, but it's data is conserved completely x - the customer is marked for deletion of it's bulk data (important data will be kept) d - the customer's bulk data was deleted, this customer can be regarded as deleted
f_read_only BOOLEAN, Flag used to enable read-only access to the systems of an inactive customer.
message_archive_period NUMBER, 4
 Number of days after which statistical data of messages is archived. -1 means this feature is switched off, 0 means to use the systems default {Req:13820}
external_attribute_conf VARCHAR, 500
 Configuration reference to core.xml for external attribute list
signature_expire_days NUMBER, 5
 number of days after which signatures expire. Default is 14 days.
logincheck_blocktime_minutes NUMBER, 5
 Minutes for how long the loginCredentials will be held in Memcache, if 0 the default value in core.xml LoginCheck config will be used.
f_truncate_data_allowed BOOLEAN, Some customers, like the CMSystems, may be used for demonstrations and can be later truncated. The truncate_customer procedure will work only for the customers having this flag on true.
password_security_strategy VARCHAR, 60
chk_pass_security_strategy
CHECK
 name of the customer
billing_country VARCHAR, 2
chck_cust_billing_country
CHECK
 Customer billing country. {Issue:60952}
regionid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_auth_region.regionid
ID of the Authentication region
generated_pass_validity_period NUMBER, 3
check_pass_setting_generated
CHECK
 Period of time (in days) of validity of the generated passwords.
defined_pass_validity_period NUMBER, 3
check_pass_setting_defined
CHECK
 Period of time (in days) of validity of the defined passwords.
reminder_period NUMBER, 3
check_pass_setting_reminder
CHECK
 Period of time (in day) indicates when user should receive a reminder about him password being invalid.
deletion_date TIMESTAMP, Timestamp of customer deletion. Gets filled by a trigger when status is set to x
default_currency VARCHAR, 3
chck_customer_def_curr
CHECK
 System level currency setting
currency_change_date TIMESTAMP, Timestamp of default system currency change

dom_customer_domain

Contains all domains of the customers.
  • constraint: name:fk_domains_ref_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
domainid NUMBER, 10
pk_customer_domain
PRIMARY KEY
 global identifier (primary key) for the domain
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer the domain belongs to 
sysname VARCHAR, 20
uni_domain_sysname
UNIQUE
check_customer_d_sysname
CHECK
rgx_customer_d_sysname
REGEX
 a unique short name of the domain; the sysname is used as the domain-specific directory-name in the templates-tree. It must be in lower case and it must contain at least one letter a-z (cf. issue 36952).
iso_language VARCHAR, 2
check_customer_d_iso_langua
CHECK
 ISO-639 code for a language
iso_country VARCHAR, 2
check_customer_d_iso_countr
CHECK
 ISO-3166 code for a country
mail_domain VARCHAR, 80
uni_domain_maildomain
UNIQUE
check_customer_d_mail_domai
CHECK
 the mail domain for the customer domain
web_domain VARCHAR, 120
 the web domain for the customer domain
fake_domain VARCHAR, 120
 the domain that will be used for responses instead of web domain
return_path_domain VARCHAR, 80
 a default return path set in outgoing emails (the From Header field in the email); taken when no return path is specified in the group
mail_account VARCHAR, 100
 the URL of a mail account receiving reply-mails when reply-to-mode is set to "collect" This is very often an IMAP account. Some customers may want to read the feedback from users. In this case this address is on the customer side. By defo is an account by eCircle. Customers has access to it.
secure_web_domain VARCHAR, 120
 the secure (https-) web domain for the customer domain (used for SSL). Same as web_domain, just for https.
fallback_sysname_one VARCHAR, 20
 For web requests the application tries: 1. find the pages under the folder with the customer domain sysname 2. if not found use the folder with the name from fallback_system_one. 3. if not found use the folder with the name from fallback_system.
fallback_sysname VARCHAR, 20
 For web requests the application tries: 1. find the pages under the folder with the customer domain sysname 2. if not found use the folder with the name from fallback_system_one. 3. if not found use the folder with the name from fallback_system. Most used value for this field is 'pages'. sysname that is used for lookups of web-pages or mail templates if they cannot be found using the regular sysname
mobile_id VARCHAR, 40
uni_domain_mobileid
UNIQUE
 the mobile number (can also be alphanumeric short form) used as the originator's number in an SMS sendout
external_service VARCHAR, 200
 Some customers may want to be informed for each subscription/unsubscription/etc. of the users in their system. External_service is an URL for the SOAP requests which are going to be send in order to inform the customer for such a kind of operations. The service address of an external system to be notified of profile and address change events.
f_change_profile_report BOOLEAN, Activates the external_service for this operation. Send an XML report to external_service if a user changes his profile.
f_blacklisting_report BOOLEAN, Activates the external_service for this operation. Send an XML report to external_service if a user is blacklisted.
f_change_email_report BOOLEAN, Activates the external_service for this operation. Send an XML report to external_service if a user changes his email address.
f_change_mobile_report BOOLEAN, Activates the external_service for this operation. Send an XML report to external_service if a user changes his mobile number.
f_full_xml_report BOOLEAN, True if XML reports should contain maximum set of information.
sysadmin_service VARCHAR, 200
 The service address of a sysadmin to be notified of bounces of system messages.
smtp_fast_transport VARCHAR, 100
 A transport chanel is a logic sender of emails/sms/fax etc. Here will be specified the name of a such a sender. The complete description of the sender stays in core.xml. Each transport is splitted in 'fast' - for an small amount of emails, 'normal' and 'backup' in case the normal returns an error. The id of the fast smtp transport to be used for this domains smtp fast sendout. Must correspond to an id in the smtp transport section of core.xml
smtp_normal_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the primary smtp transport to be used for this domains smtp sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the smtp transport section of core.xml
smtp_backup_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the secondary smtp transport to be used for this domains smtp sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the smtp transport section of core.xml. Secondary is only used if primary transport fails.
mobile_fast_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the fast mobile transport to be used for this domains mobile fast sendout. Must correspond to an id in the mobile transport section of core.xml
mobile_normal_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the primary mobile transport to be used for this domains sms sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the mobile transport section of core.xml
mobile_backup_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the secondary mobile transport to be used for this domains mobile sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the mobile transport section of core.xml. Secondary is only used if primary transport fails.
fax_fast_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the fast fax transport to be used for this domains fax fast sendout. Must correspond to an id in the fax transport section of core.xml
fax_normal_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the primary fax transport to be used for this domains fax sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the mobile transport section of core.xml
fax_backup_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the secondary fax transport to be used for this domains fax sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the fax transport section of core.xml. Secondary is only used if primary transport fails.
smtp_preprocessed_transport VARCHAR, 100
 The id of the prepocessed mta transport to be used for this domains smtp sendouts. Must correspond to an id in the smtp transport section of core.xml
active CHAR, 1
check_customer_d_active
CHECK
 used for administration task; not used by application. a - active, i - inactive. A customer is activ if at least an domain is active. Deactivating all domains the customer will be deactivated ( all mappings for web pages will be deactivated ).
sys_msg_headers VARCHAR, 1500
 List of headers which will be added to every System-Message. Header information must be formatted like this: from: service@customer.in X-CUSTHDR: some value reply-to: replies@customer.in These headers will be added to/override headers with the same name which are defined in a system message template
domainkeys_name VARCHAR, 40
 Domainkeys support: the domain name
domainkeys_public VARCHAR, 255
 Domainkeys support: the domain public key
image_domain VARCHAR, 2000
 A comma separated list of domain names to be used instead of the web domain for picture proxy URLs
cookie_maxage NUMBER, 8
 Per domain config for the lifetime of cookies in seconds
locale_variant VARCHAR, 20
 the locale variant (used for translations) for the customer domain
feature_set VARCHAR, 2000
 Lists the feature set that is especially enabled for this customer. Should be a comma delimited list.
creation_date DATE, date of creation.
cdn_domain VARCHAR, 120
 It's used for the CDN support. Image URL's based on web domain should be replaced with an URL based on the CDN domain (when defined)

dom_email_domain_whitelist_template

Contains templates for customer role specific whitelist of allowed email domains. The entries in this table will be copied for new customers on creation.

FK --> dom_user_role.roleid
references the user role
configuration_type VARCHAR, 50
check_tmpl_conf_type
CHECK
 Specifies the type of configuration: 1) NONE - no special white lists (default for customer roles: Client Admin, Superuser and custom roles 1-8) 2) SPECIFIC - differentiate white list domains per system role 3) ALL - same white listed domains for all customer system roles 4) INTERNAL - indicates that the value can be changed only via SQL (default for ADMIN and PM roles)
domain_whitelist TEXT, semicolon separated list of email domains allowed for login

dom_deleted_users

This table collects minimal informations about deleted users. It will be filled by a before delete trigger placed on the DOM_USER table, and emptied periodically by an archive task.


  • constraint: name:uni_deletedusers_ciduid
    customerid, userid, type:PRIMARY KEY
  • constraint: name:chk_del_user_logonid
    type:CHECK
  • constraint: name:fk_deleteduser_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer the user belongs to
userid NUMBER, 10
 The ID of the deleted user. This is NOT a foreign key, by the time the user gets here, it will be deleted from DOM_USER.
email VARCHAR, 200
 The email address of the deleted user.
mobile_number VARCHAR, 200
 mobile number of the deleted user.
fax_number VARCHAR, 2000
 fax number of the deleted user.
registrationdate TIMESTAMP, The registration date of the user. See DOM_USER for details.
deletiondate TIMESTAMP, The date/time when the user was deleted from DOM_USER.
f_anonymized BOOLEAN, Defines weather user was deleted by anonymization (GDPR) or normal deletion


dom_user

Contains information about registered users.
  • constraint: name:chk_user_languageid
    type:CHECK
  • constraint: name:chk_user_countryid
    type:CHECK
  • constraint: name:fk_user_ref_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_user_ref_role
    references:
    in dom_user_role.roleid for roleid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:uni_user_email
    customerid, email, type:UNIQUE
  • constraint: name:uni_user_mobile
    mobile_number, customerid, type:UNIQUE
  • constraint: name:uni_user_fax
    fax_number, customerid, type:UNIQUE
  • constraint: name:chk_user_logonid
    type:CHECK
Column Definition Description
userid NUMBER, 10
pk_user
PRIMARY KEY
 global unique identifier for the user
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer the user belongs to
source CHAR, 1
 How the user came into into the system: i : Import a : Add w : Web m : Mail s : SMS u : Unknown o : OK 250 seedlist f : Forward - In many emails there is a link 'Invite a frient'. Users which gets into the system using this link will have 'f' as source. p : Preview - By sendouts the sender can do a message preview towards any email address he wants, even if the addresse does not exists in the system. In this case this new address will be saved in dom_user with source='p'. x : SOAP
roleid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_user_role.roleid
the customer-role of the user. The mapping to permission is done using dom_role_permission table.
email VARCHAR, 129
chk_user_email
CHECK
 email-address of the user (unique within customer)
f_email_verified BOOLEAN, After the import this flag is false. After the first email send and confirmed by the user ( double-opt-in, etc ) this flag will be set to true. True if email address is verified
mobile_number VARCHAR, 18
 mobile number of the user (unique within customer)
f_mobile_number_verified BOOLEAN, true if mobile number is verified
fax_number VARCHAR, 2000
 fax number of the user (unique within customer)
password CHAR, 32
 encrypted password of the user
firstname VARCHAR, 50
 forename
lastname VARCHAR, 50
 family name
title NUMBER, 1
check_user_title
CHECK
 1=Mr. 2=Mrs NULL=unset
nickname VARCHAR, 20
 moniker (unique within customer)
identifier VARCHAR, 2000
 customer specified identifier for user (unique with customer). This is a kind of userid on the customer side. We are not checking the uniqueness of this field over the customer users.
dateofbirth DATE, user's birthday
zipcode VARCHAR, 10
 zipcode for user's address
iso_language VARCHAR, 2
 ISO-639 code for a language
iso_country VARCHAR, 2
 ISO-3166 code for a country
timezone NUMBER, 3
 The time zone of the user. The encoding is normalized using an eCmessenger specific mapping. To see the possible values see DbEncodingUtil.
registrationdate TIMESTAMP, day when user registered (meaning: was inserted into database; can differ for example from date when user's subscription-email was written or arrived)
agentid NUMBER, 4
 determines the mail agent used by this user. Not longer in use. Should be the browser type of the user.
partnerid NUMBER, 5

dom_selection_term

Contains selections of campaigns. The selections are coded in XML. For one selection there is one record in this table. One selection can be used for: 1) calculating the available number of recipients 2) transferring the users to a given group Selections may be used for : selections, send to selection ( filtered sendout ), mapping tool, cms ( the user will edit a selection in the selection editor, and the selection definition will be used in an IF tag. ).


  • constraint: name:fk_selectionterm_ref_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_selectionterm_ref_sysuser
    references:
    in dom_system_user.systemauthorid for systemauthorid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
selectiontermid NUMBER, 10
pk_selection__selectiont
PRIMARY KEY
 identifier for selection
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer the selection term belongs to
title VARCHAR, 100
 The title of the selection.
systemauthorid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_system_user.systemauthorid
references the system user as author of the selection
description VARCHAR, 2000
 description of the selection
term TEXT, the XML code. This is the definition of the selection saved as CLOB.
last_calc_date TIMESTAMP, date of last calculation. This date is setted for the selections which are doing the calculation of the count
last_transfer_date TIMESTAMP, date of last transfer. Setted for the selections which are doing selection of the recipients to a group.
recipient_count NUMBER, 10
 calculated count of recipients for last calculation. For the calculation selections this is the single field which will get modified by the selection. Here will be written the number of users which have fullfilled the selection criteria.
f_include_preview BOOLEAN, true if users with the dom_user.source = preview or forward should be included in the selection
status VARCHAR, 15
 current status of the selection. Listed in SelectionTerm.Status
f_visible BOOLEAN, true if selection is visible in the overview page
created TIMESTAMP, time of creation.
last_modified TIMESTAMP, time of last modification
no_of_total_chunks NUMBER, 5
 total no of chunks to process for this selection
no_of_processed_chunks NUMBER, 5
 no of already processed chunks for this selection
f_simple BOOLEAN, true if this selectionterm only contains attribute nodes (used for cms gui and mapping feature). For cms and gui selections there is not allowed to use conditions on other messages ( clickers, openers, etc ). Only profile attribute can be interogated. In this case the f_simple field is set to true.
f_archived BOOLEAN, if true/1 the selection term is archived.
timezone NUMBER, 3
 The time zone of the selection.
execution_mode NUMBER, 2
 0 == execute by sql join query (default), 1 == translate to EL and execute in memory, 4 == selection using related data
hbase_mode BOOLEAN, false == hbase mode is off (default), true == hbase mode is on
selectionplanid VARCHAR, 64
 Set only for selection terms which correspond to a selection plan managed through selection builder.
interactionplanid VARCHAR, 64
 Set only for selection terms that are created dynamically via interaction planner. Such selections are removed when interaction plan is being deactivated.
interactionplan_version NUMBER, 5
 Set only for selection terms that are created dynamically via interaction planner. Such selections are removed when interaction plan is being deactivated.
interactionplan_iteration NUMBER, 5
 Set only for selection terms that are created dynamically via interaction planner. Indicate iteration of automation

dom_scheduled_task

Contains data for scheduled tasks. Scheduled task are the one which can be set via the web interface. The task engine runs like this: 1. ScheduledTaskProcessorTask reads which ScheduledTasks has to be executed. 2. For each task he founds he pushes a job: ProcessScheduledTaskJob. 3. If the task is about a selection the job will do the selection. 4. Call of the GenericFilter.


  • constraint: name:chk_sched_task_timezone
    type:CHECK
  • constraint: name:fk_scheduled_task_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_schedtask_selectionterm
    references:
    in dom_selection_term.selectiontermid for selectiontermid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_scheduled_task_diagram
    references:
    in dom_auto_builder_diagram.diagramid for diagramid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_scheduled_task_systemowner
    references:
    in dom_system_user.systemownerid for systemownerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
scheduledtaskid NUMBER, 10
pk_scheduled__scheduledt
PRIMARY KEY
 the primary key number for this scheduled task
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer the scheduled task belongs to
application VARCHAR, 20
 sets a label (normally a version number) to separate the events if more than one cluster access the DB in parallel. In this way one scheduled task will run on a single cluster.
systemownerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_system_user.systemownerid
references the system user owning this event-rule
title VARCHAR, 100
 the name of the scheduled task
description VARCHAR, 2000
 a verbose description of the scheduled task
action_calls NUMBER, 10
 the number of actions calls issued through this task. Increased by each execution of the task. The task usually calls a specific filter.
action_errors NUMBER, 10
 the number of failed actions calls issued through this task
f_single_user BOOLEAN, if true/1 the task is used for single users. If is false ( 0 ) than a selection has to be done. The selection is specified in dom_scheduled_task.selectiontermid. The action will be called for each recipient returned by the selection. If true, the action will be called one single time.
f_active BOOLEAN, Only active tasks will be executed.
status VARCHAR, 15
 The workflow status of the document; one of INACTIVE, SCHEDULED, ACTIVE, DONE, STOPPED
f_delete_on_last_exec BOOLEAN, if true/1 the task is deleted after last execution. For tasks which will happend only one time this flag will be set. After execution the task will be deleted.
f_repetitive BOOLEAN, if true/1 the task is executed more than once
f_holidays BOOLEAN, if true/1 the task is executed on holidays
f_non_holidays BOOLEAN, if true/1 the task is executed on non-holidays
iso_country VARCHAR, 2
check_scheduled__iso_countr
CHECK
 country of the task (important for holidays)
last_error VARCHAR, 4000
 error message of last failure while running the task.
last_error_date TIMESTAMP, timestamp of last failure while running the task.
selectiontermid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_selection_term.selectiontermid
reference to selectionterm used to select users for scheduled tasks
action VARCHAR, 100
 the full class name of the action. This is the class which will be called by the Scheduled Task. The class is a GenericFilter inside the eCm ( see com.domeus.filter.generic ).
timezone NUMBER, 3
 The time zone of the task.
prev_execution_time TIMESTAMP, This field is used to preserve the value of the column last_execution_time during task execution. From the running task's point of view, last_execution_time refers to the current execution.
last_execution_time TIMESTAMP, If not NULL it contains the timestamp of the last task execution.
next_execution_time TIMESTAMP, If not NULL the timestamp when this task should be executed the next time.
first_execution_time TIMESTAMP, The timestamp when this task should be executed for the first time.
final_execution_time TIMESTAMP, The timestamp after which this task should be not be executed any more.
f_remind_expiration BOOLEAN, states whether remind should be send before task expiration end
expiration_reminders VARCHAR, 200
 list of userPK's which a reminder should be send to, in a format 1,2,3
last_execution_end_time TIMESTAMP, The last timestamp when the task was executed successfully
period_unit CHAR, 1
 the time unit which is added to the last execution time to calculate the next execution time(see also period_increment): h - hours d - days w - weeks m - moths
period_increment NUMBER, 3
 the amount of time units (depending on period_unit) that is added to the last execution time to calculate the next execution time
execution_days CHAR, 7
 Defines at which days the task is executed. Every character stands for on day of the week, the leftmost character stands for monday the rightmost character for sunday. If the character contains an 'x' the task possibly fires that day, if the character contains an 'o' the task will not fire at that day of week. Example: 'ooxoxoo' means task will only fire on wednesdays and fridays.
f_running BOOLEAN, if true/1 the scheduled task is currently running
f_archived BOOLEAN, if true/1 the scheduled task is archived.
action_handle VARCHAR, 100
 a action-specific string containing some id; will be not null when task is running and action is processed asynchronously; task uses this handle to query the actions's status
origin VARCHAR, 200
 origin of the entity
root_origin VARCHAR, 200
 root origin of the entity
diagramid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_auto_builder_diagram.diagramid
references the diagram the scheduled task corresponds to
automationplanid NUMBER, 10
 references the automationplan the scheduled task corresponds to
iteration NUMBER, 10
 determines number of recurring IP iterations
f_can_delay BOOLEAN, if true/1 the task can be started with some delay. Used to don't run all heavy jobs(like member import) in the same time
automationplan_version NUMBER, 5
 references the automationplan version the scheduled task corresponds to
ical_rule VARCHAR, 200
 String encoding a ICal recurring rule.

reply_to_handling CHAR, 1
chk_reply_handling_value
CHECK
 The strategy for setting the reply-to address for group mails. See also the "reply_to_email" and "reply_to_personal" fields, which is used by some of the strategies, and ignored by the others. This is an enumerated type, with the following possible values (See also the DbEncodingUtil class, the mappings live there actually): * ValueDescription * AAuthor - use the message author's address * UUnsubscribe - use unsubscribe address * MModerators - replies will go to owners/moderators * GGroup - replies will go to the group address * OOriginal - don't add any reply-to address, use original if present * CCollect - collect replies to the group's mail-box * DCollect_including_autoresponses - collect replies to the group's mail-box. Additionally all responses, including also auto-responses are stored in another mail folder * FForward - same as Collect, but it also forwards the incoming replies to the specified address * HForward_including_autoresponses - same as Forward, but also the auto-responses are stored in another mail folder * IIgnore - ignore replies * SSpecified - use specified reply-to address for all group mails * VEvent - replies trigger an event
reply_to_email VARCHAR, 100
 Email address used by some of the reply to strategies. Each of the possible reply-to strategies uses it for it's need, or ignores it. Usage of the reply_to_email field by the different reply to strategies: Use as reply to address in the outgoing group mailsmail - Specified Forward the incoming replies to this address - Forward Ignore - All not mentioned above.
reply_to_personal VARCHAR, 100
 personal of reply-to
member_cleaning_date TIMESTAMP, The date when the group's members and attributes was cleaned by DeleteMembersByGroupCreationDateFilter
from_handling CHAR, 1
check_group_from_handl
CHECK
 The strategy for setting the from address for group mails. See also the "from_email" and "from_personal" fields, which is used by some of the strategies, and ignored by the others. This is an enumerated type, with the following possible values (See also the DbEncodingUtil class, the mappings live there actually): A - Use the message author's address (Author) G - Use the group address (Group) S - Use specified from address for all group mails (Specified)
from_email VARCHAR, 100
 Email address used as from header for outgoing group email messages.
from_personal VARCHAR, 100
 Personal of from header

check_group_mobile_rep

 What to do with an incoming mobile message: 0 - ignored 1 - send to group 2 - send to owner and moderators 3 - configurable email 4 - group email account 5 - unsubscribe instructions 6 - subscription 7 - event 8 - email subscription 9 - mobile subscribe and save inbound message

 if given it sets the sendout channel that is preferably used in sendouts of this group

 if -1 timspeed is calculated for each message in order to distribute it evenly over time slot if 0 (default) all messages of this group are sent out with full speed; if greater than zero it determines the maximum number of messages sent per hour (for one sendout)
f_group_visible BOOLEAN, More used for Domeus, in order to hide the group from the public catalog. On Domeus there were some groups for campains build. This groups didn't show in the group overview. After a while this groups were deleted. 0 - group will not appear in any catalogues 1 - group will appear in catalogue
f_hide_from_user BOOLEAN, This flag is more restrictive as the f_group_visible. 0 - group will appear in the user's group overviews 1 - group will not appear in the user's group overviews
f_deleted BOOLEAN, All queries on dom_group has the condition f_deleted=0. So a group with this flag on true will no longer be visible. A scheduled task deletes this group later on. 0 - group is not scheduled to be deleted 1 - group is scheduled to be deleted
f_inbox_delivery_tracking BOOLEAN, if true inbox delivery tracking for sendouts is done
f_indiv_link_tracking BOOLEAN, if true individual link tracking for sendouts is done
f_subscr_notified BOOLEAN, 0 - no notification on subscription 1 - if a user subscribes to this group moderators/owner will receive a notification message
f_unsubscr_notified BOOLEAN, 0 - no notification on unsubscription 1 - if a user unsubscribes from this group moderators/owner will receive a notification message
f_owner_pays BOOLEAN, 0 - if billing is enabled every email will be invoiced to originator of the message 1 - if billing is enabled every email will be invoiced to the owner of the group
f_respect_user_bounces BOOLEAN, if true system-wide bounces are excluded from sendouts. The system-wide bounces are the bounced users marked in dom_user table ( and not dom_member table )
f_msg_individ_to BOOLEAN, 0 - the to-header of a group message will contain the group's email address 1 - the from-header of a group message will contain the recipient's email address
f_msg_individ_to_placeholder TEXT, contains placeholder that can be personalized, if set it will be used instead of default name of the user
f_mailin_password BOOLEAN, 0 - no password required for incoming group messages 1 - The password should stay in the message subject to be possible to send this message further to the group.
f_archived BOOLEAN, true if the group is archived. Some customers have older groups which should not be visible in overviews but they should be leaved in database, for their statistics, etc. This flag can be set/unset by the user, while the f_group_visible not.
tracking_flags NUMBER, 3
 List of "Bit - Description" entries: 0 - link tracking for text part 1 - link tracking for HTML part 2 - link tracking for rich media part 3 - user/reader tracking for HTML part 4 - user/reader tracking for rich media part 5 - user/reader tracking pixel at top for HTML part 6 - user/reader tracking pixel at top for rich media part
f_subscr_confirmed BOOLEAN, The double-opt-in mechanism works like this: * The user subscribes himself on web by filling in his email address. After this the user will be inserted as pending in the group. * He receives an email where stays a link, he has to click on. Now his status will be turned on to active member. If this flag is false the user will be immediatelly ( after first step ) member in the group. 0 - subscriptions do not have to be confirmed by the new member 1 - new members will be 'pending' first and receive a mail to confirm their subscription
f_subscr_permitted BOOLEAN, This is a typically Domeus flag. For some groups the subscription may be blocked by this flag. 0 - subscription to this group is not allowed at all 1 - users may subscribe to this group
f_subscr_moderated BOOLEAN, Subscription in this group are allowed, but they have to be confirmed by a moderator ( or member with a certain role ). 0 - subscriptions are accepted without moderation first 1 - subscriptions have to be confirmed by a moderator of this group
f_is_campaign_group BOOLEAN, 0 - group is not used in a campaign 1 - group is used in a campaign
f_supergroup BOOLEAN, Should be true if this group is also in the dom_supergroup_group table in the supergroupid field. By sendout the statistics will be refreshed for bought: group and supergroup. When a click comes, it will be tracked to bought: message and supermessage. There is no check of the uniquness of users during sendout ( if one user is member in more than one subgroup of the supergroup ). The uniqueness of the statistics is done, for example, on reader tracking / supermessageid by the fact that the dom_reader_tracking has a primary key on ( messageid, userid ). 0 - group is not a supergroup 1 - group is a supergroup any may have subgroups
f_max_msg_limit BOOLEAN, When set to true the feature of limiting the maximal number of messages pro group is activated. This has to do with: If a user has a limit of 3 email in the last week, the dom_user_ext_... will store BOOKPERIOD = 7 , BOOKMAXEMAILCOUNT = 3 The BOOKMAP stores a map of bits for the received emails. BOOKMAPEND stores a date for the oldest message marked in BOOKMAP. So, if BOOKMAPEND is too old, this is ignored. If BOOKMAPEND is, let's say, one week before, the number of bits in BOOKMAP will be count and so we know how many messages the user received in the last week. 0 - maximum message limitation is off 1 - maximum message limitation is on
f_disable_robinson_list BOOLEAN, The robinson list is a list of emails and domains who should not receive any emails from us. This is an extra-blacklist feature. While the blacklist deletes the users from system, this leaves them there but filters them out not to become any email. When this flag is setted, the robinson check is disabled. 0 - robinson list is not disabled 1 - robinson list ist disabled
no_of_msg NUMBER, 10
 number of messages to this group with status 'sent' (STATUS=2)
no_of_mod_msg NUMBER, 10
 Moderated messages are messages writen by a person ( with message_write permission ) and send by another person ( with message_post permission ). This is often used on domeus. This counter indicates the number of messages in this group that have to be moderated. number of messages to this group with status 'moderated' (STATUS=3)
groupcategoryid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_group_category.groupcategoryid
references the group category this group belongs to
reminder_period NUMBER, 2
 Using the double-opt-in mechanism a user has to click on the invitation email to confirm the invitation. If he does not do this, he will receive an invitation email each reminder_period days. NULL - invitation reminders are disabled >0 - frequence in days in which invited users receive a reminder mail
last_reminder_date TIMESTAMP, last timestamp when invited members of this group received a reminder mail
html_msg_header TEXT, header for HTML messages
html_msg_footer TEXT, footer for HTML messages
welcome_msg_subj VARCHAR, 100
 subject for welcome messages for new members
created TIMESTAMP, time of creation.
external_service VARCHAR, 4000
 The service addresses of an external system to be notified of group events (currently used with MailingFactory to forward subscriptions/unsubscriptions and other reports). Format is json.
xml_report_flags NUMBER, 3
 A bitmap of flags for the configuration of external XML reports to be sent on different events. The meaning of the bits is described in the following table: 0 - Send subscription report 1 - Skip internal subscription process (only send report, don't subscribe) - used for partners who wish to moderate themselves the subscription process 2 - Send unsubscription report 3 - Skip internal unsubscription process (only send report, don't unsubscribe) - used for partners who wish to moderate themselves the unsubscription process 4 - Send bounce report 5 - Send full XML. If false, only the minimal information will be sent, if true, full user/member information is included 6 - Send profile change report
subscription_price NUMBER, 9
 price per new subscription. Used for partners, as a payment for each address they brought.
sysadmin_service VARCHAR, 200
 The service address of a sysadmin to be notified of bounces of system messages.
timeslot_start TIMESTAMP, time slot start time. An time interval when the sendouts should take place. The interval is valid during one single day. This because some customers may want their sendouts to take place only during in the morning, evening, etc. The pushed sendouts will be repushed if the sendout timeslot does not fit this timeslot.
timeslot_end TIMESTAMP, time slot end time, the interval limit toghether with timeslot_start
timeslot_timezone NUMBER, 3
 The timezone of the time slot. NOTE: The timeslot is stored as CET. This timezone is only used to re-format the timeslot for display.
messagecategoryid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_message_category.messagecategoryid

dom_billing_totals

Contains the cumulated billings for all users appearing in DOM_BILLING_ITEMS. One user is listed one single time in this table. The user financial situations is than defined by credits - debits ( = payed - consumed ). During usual work the table may be locked with SQL commands, in order to solve concurential access problems on the same rows.


  • constraint: name:fk_billing_totals_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_billing_totals_systemuser
    references:
    in dom_system_user.systemuserid for systemuserid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:uni_billing_userid
    systemuserid, type:PRIMARY KEY
Column Definition Description
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer owning this account
systemuserid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_system_user.systemuserid
references the systemuser owning this account
credits NUMBER, 60
 sum (total_units) of all confirmed credit billing items related to this user. Credits increases with each paymet that the customer did. This is usually done before the sendout takes place. By sendout will be checked if this amount covers the sendout costs.
debits NUMBER, 60
 sum (total_units) of all confirmed debit billing items related to this user. Debits is what the user already consumed ( by sendouts, etc. ).
tentative_debits NUMBER, 60
 Deprecated. No longer in use. sum (total_units) of all tentative debit billing items related to this user.
reminder_limit NUMBER, 21
check_billing_to_reminder_l
CHECK
 if the users balance (credits - debits ) gets below that number, the user will receive a reminder mail


dom_billing_items

One row contains a action that causes a change to the billing account of a user.
  • constraint: name:fk_billing_items_system_user
    references:
    in dom_system_user.systemuserid for systemuserid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_billingitems_group
    references:
    in dom_group_durable.groupid for groupid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY

Column Definition Description
billingid NUMBER, 10
unq_billing_it_billingid
PRIMARY KEY
 unique identifier of the billing item
systemuserid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_system_user.systemuserid
This references the dom_billing_totals.systemuserid, in order to make sure that the totals record is also written there.
type NUMBER, 5
 0 - debit item (account will be decreased) 1 - credit item (account will be increased)
subject NUMBER, 5
 Please see the BillingSubject class for a complete list of encodings. Each subject may be piece based or volume based. This has an influence over total_units on the calculation. 0 - unspecified reason for the booking 3 - INCREASE_BALANCE 4 - MAIL_OUT_VOLUME 5 - MAIL_IN_VOLUME 6 - RESPONSE_VOLUME 7 - DECREASE_BALANCE 8 - FORWARDED_MESSAGE_VOLUME 10 - PICTURE_HOSTING 11 - SYSTEM_MESSAGE_EMAIL_VOLUME 12 - IMPORT 13 - MAIL_OUT_PIECE_SMALL 14 - MAIL_OUT_PIECE_BIG 15 - RESPONSE_PIECE_SMALL 16 - RESPONSE_PIECE_BIG 17 - SYSTEM_MESSAGE_EMAIL_PIECE_SMALL 18 - SYSTEM_MESSAGE_EMAIL_PIECE_BIG 19 - MAIL_IN_PIECE_SMALL 20 - MAIL_IN_PIECE_BIG 21 - FORWARDED_MESSAGE_PIECE_SMALL 22 - FORWARDED_MESSAGE_PIECE_BIG 30 - SMS_OUT 31 - SYSTEM_MESSAGE_SMS 32 - SMS_IN 41 - SUBSCRIPTION_CREDIT 42 - SUBSCRIPTION_DEBIT 50 - SINGLE_MESSAGE_VOLUME 51 - SINGLE_MESSAGE_PIECE_SMALL 52 - SINGLE_MESSAGE_PIECE_BIG 53 - SINGLE_MESSAGE_SMS 54 - MOBILE_APP_TOUCHPOINTS 60 - API_USAGE 61 - LANDING_PAGE_IMPRESSION 62 - WEB_GROUP_TOUCHPOINTS 63 - INBOX_RENDERING 64 - INBOX_MONITORING
messageid NUMBER, 10
 references the message related to this billing
groupid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_group_durable.groupid
references the group related to this billing. Usually specified together with the messageid. But for imports, for example, only the groupid is specified, and no messageid.
no_of_bytes NUMBER, 18
 number of billable bytes. By sendout is the sendout volume, by import the size of the import file, etc. Not for all entries exists a value here ( sms, etc. ). This number is in bytes; by calculation will be used this number transformed into GigaBytes.
total_units NUMBER, 21
 the total number of units which are billed. When the subject is piece based, then the number_of_actions will be used for computing, and if volume based is, than number of bytes. total_units = amount * price; amount = one of ( see subject ): no_of_bytes, no_of_actions; price = dom_billing_price.units;
no_of_actions NUMBER, 10
 number of actions that were performed for this item. For sendouts is the number of sended email. The value is present even if the sendout will be calculated by volume. By import the number of imported users is listed here. By bounces the number of bounced users. Here is always a value. By adding credits here will stay an '1'.
status NUMBER, 1
check_status
CHECK
 Depreciated. Together with tentative_debits no longer in use. 1 - confirmed (effectively invoiced) 2 - tentative (temporarily invoiced)
billingdate TIMESTAMP, timestamp of creation resp. last update of this item
description VARCHAR, 400
 an optional description of the billed transaction. When the messageid is in, this field will contain ( redundant ) the message name and message subject from the message, separated by '/'. This is so as the name and subject should be available even if the message was deleted. There is no Fk to dom_message.
micrositeid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_microsite.micrositeid
references the microsite (landing page) related to this billing
webgroupid NUMBER, 10
 id of the webgroup for which either owner or executor is billed


dom_billing_items_temp

Staging table used to to avoid contention on billing items which are stored in an aggregated form (daily items). Instead of performing (potentially concurrent) updates on the same table row, the source processes perform inserts into this table and a system task regularly aggregates the data from this table and updates the final billing data in the table dom_billing_items.

chk_message_status
CHECK
 Messages writen over web will go : 1) immediate: Processing -> Sent 2) scheduled: Scheduled -> Processing -> Sent Over mail-in: 1) Incoming -> Processing -> Sent For all is valid also the status Moderated. 0 - incoming. Very short after this status will be turned on processing ( is an interme 1 - processing 2 - sent 3 - moderated 4 - scheduled 5 - cancelled 6 - interrupted 7 - draft 9 - ready 10 - transporting 12 - parked
type CHAR, 1
chk_message_type
CHECK
 the type of the message n - normal m - split_main e - split_test i - single s - supermessage u - submessage for supermessage t - test p - pre_split_main
f_archived BOOLEAN, true if the message is archived. The user can set/unset this flag. The archived messages will not be visible in overviews. But still available.
f_auto_archived BOOLEAN, true if the message was already automatically archived. The user cannot set/unset this flag. {Req:13820}
version NUMBER, 7
 incremental version number starting with 1. This is used for the link caches. This will be increased when after sendout a link will be edited.
name VARCHAR, 250
 Message name.
external_id VARCHAR, 250
 External ID.
senderprofileid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_sender_profile.senderprofileid
references the sender profile which is used
schedule_date TIMESTAMP, this might be NULL for all those messages which have no schedule_date defined. e.g. split, super, system messages and test messages. for group messages, this will have current date to processing immediately or contains the date the message was scheduled to be preprocessed. in business logic this date MUST earlier or equal to transfer_date. The scheduled messages will go over the dom_scheduled_task. This is somehow redundant since the entry in dom_scheduled taks specifies the same date.
transfer_date TIMESTAMP, if NULL,only allowed when schedule_date is NULL as well, the message was sent out immediately. otherwise contains the date the message was scheduled to be transfered. This is somehow redundant since the entry in dom_scheduled taks specifies the same date.
hdr_orig_date TIMESTAMP, date when this message was created taken from the message's 'Date'-header
hdr_from VARCHAR, 100
 email address taken from the 'From'-header of the message
hdr_from_name VARCHAR, 100
 personal name taken from the 'From'-header of the message
hdr_subject VARCHAR, 3000
 message subject taken from the 'Subject'-header of the message
additional_headers VARCHAR, 4000
 Custom message headers.
subject_prefix VARCHAR, 500
 text that has been inserted at the beginning of subject of this message at sendout time
message_size NUMBER, 10
 size of the message in bytes; until this message is not completely sent out (status=2) this will be an estimated value, after sendout it contains the average size of the sent message (only emails, no SMS will be considered here). It could contain 0 if the message is a sms-only message.
no_of_recipients NUMBER, 10
 This is the number of expected messages (all kinds of formats or channels) that will be sent out ( without bounced users, etc ). This number is written down before the sendout to take place. If a users is suppost to receive several messages of different channels, they are each counted individually.
no_of_actual_recipients NUMBER, 10
 This couter will increase during the sendout with the real number of recipients to which the message was really sent to. An aproximative progress of the sendout would be ( no_of_actual_recipients / no_of_recipients ) * 100 If a users receives messages of different channels, they are each counted individually
no_of_unique_act_recpt NUMBER, 10
 The real number of unique(!) recipients to which the message was really sent to. Only incremented for single messages! else 0
no_of_unique_clicks NUMBER, 10
 Number of distinct users who received this message and have clicked on at least one link from this message.
no_of_indiv_clicks NUMBER, 10
 Number of non-distinct users who received this message and have clicked on at least one individual link from this message.
no_of_unsubscriptions NUMBER, 10
 Some messages ( for Germany should be all ) contains a link 'Unsubscribe from this newsletter'. This counter keeps the number of users which clicked on this unsubscription link.
no_of_profile_edits NUMBER, 10
 Some messages may contain a link pointing to the user 'edit profile' page. This number counts the number of distinct users who clicked this link.
send_start_date NEW_TIMESTAMP, This date will be set by the BulkMessageJob. time when sending out of message startedtimestamp when the send-out-job was started
send_end_date NEW_TIMESTAMP, time when sending out of message has finishedtimestamp when the send-out-jog was finished
transfer_start_date NEW_TIMESTAMP, This date will be set by the UpdatePreProcessedSendoutStatusTask. time when our internal mta starts sending out messages
transfer_end_date NEW_TIMESTAMP, 1) This date will be set by the UpdatePreProcessedSendoutStatusTask. time when our internal mta finish sending out messages 2) Also for mobile Push with local/best time to sendout it will be set in in UpdatePreProcessedSendoutStatusTask, when APX sendout is finished
no_of_attachments NUMBER, 10
 number of attachments in the message
f_individual_attachment BOOLEAN, true if message has individual attachments
f_system_message BOOLEAN, true if message can/should be used as system message replacement. If set this message can be use later when creating a system message.
created TIMESTAMP, timestamp when message was inserted into this table
last_modified TIMESTAMP, timestamp when message was last modified this table
no_of_readers NUMBER, 10
 count of recipients who actually read the message (determined via user-tracking). This number is the number of unique readers of the message.
no_of_click_thru_links NUMBER, 10
 no of links in message which are prepared for click-thru-tracking
traffic_size NUMBER, 22
 number of bytes send out for this message; this column is updated after each sendout-chunk and consideres only emails no SMSes
no_of_jobs NUMBER, 4
 no of sendout-jobs left to process this message; if zero all jobs are finished. The sendout goes over more SendMessageJobs. The last SendMessageJob has to do some statistic calculations. The Job knows that he is the last by reading this counter ( if is 0 means he is the last one ).
no_of_bounces NUMBER, 10
 number of distinct users who bounced this message
no_of_total_chunks NUMBER, 5
 total no of chunks to process for this message. For computing the progress of the sendout the no_of_recipients-no_of_actual_recipients may be not usefull. As sample is the sendToSelection, where the number of recipients is unknown. In this case we use this two counters: no_of_total_chunks and no_of_processed_chunks
no_of_processed_chunks NUMBER, 5
 no of already processed chunks for this message
no_of_personalization_tags NUMBER, 5
 no of personalization tags in this message
bulk_job_id VARCHAR, 128
 the job-id of the respective BulkMessageJob; is set to NULL when the status is 'sent'
scheduledtaskid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_scheduled_task.scheduledtaskid

chk_msg_rcpt_pct_max
CHECK
 percent of recipients who should receive this message. Instead of specifying the number of users, its specifies a procent. This is used by split sendout: few test messages will be sent to see which is the best performance for each of the test messages. For each test message will be defined the procent ( from the global amount ). Then the sendout will be done will the rest of the users.
transport_progress NUMBER, 5
chk_transport_progress_min
CHECK
chk_transport_progress_max
CHECK
 Progress which occurs on MTA side
original_messageid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_message.original_messageid
unique identifier of the original message it the message is a clone
description TEXT, The marketing manager's description of the message's purpose.
last_modifier_id NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_system_user.last_modifier_id
References the last modifier of the message. If NULL, the last modifier is either unknown (as in the case of a guest user), or he is no longer registered in the system.
channel_type NUMBER, 5
 The value describing the content types which given draft message consists of. The combination is presented in table above: 1 email only email 2 sms only sms 3 email, sms sum of 1 and 2 4 push only push 6 push, sms sum of 4 and 2 7 email, sms, push sum of 1, 2 and 4 * The value above does not equals to channel type in MDS !!! as this is an old implementation.
group_size NUMBER, 10
 Number of active members within group at start time of the sendout. Group size is being calculated at the very beginning of a sendout and cannot change afterwards.
inbox_monitoring_provider VARCHAR, 20
 Defines (if not null) if inbox monitoring is used for given message, and which inbox monitoring provider is in use.
best_sendout_time BOOLEAN, Defines if sendout should use best time to send from datastore.
best_sendout_time_default VARCHAR, 75
 Should be set only if best_sendout_time == true, but is not mandatory. This value indicates when the sendout should happen to users which don't have BST calculated. If best_sendout_time == true and best_sendout_time_default == null then users without BST calculated will be part of immediate sendout.
recipient_limit NUMBER, 10
 Maximum sendout recipients

dom_task

Contains all tasks executed periodically on the different application machines. All the tasks are loaded by the TimeService when the application starts up. Additionally the TimeService polls this table regularly to detect any changes in the command-flags or configuration settings (f_changed = 1). Every application instance reads only those entries from the table which are designated for its host (set in column ''host'').


  • constraint: name:fk_task_ref_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
taskid VARCHAR, 50
pk_dom_task
PRIMARY KEY
 unique identifier of the task
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer the task belongs to
classname VARCHAR, 200
 full qualified name of the Java-class containing the code for the task
application VARCHAR, 20
 sets a label (normally a version number) to separate the tasks if several different systems (applications) access the DB in parallel
timetable VARCHAR, 200
 'cron'-like string describing the execution times of the task
host VARCHAR, 200
 IP-address of the machine that is supposed to execute the task
description VARCHAR, 4000
 human readable description of the task
f_is_enabled BOOLEAN, if 0 the task is not active and will never be executed
f_is_running BOOLEAN, if 1 the task is currently running within it designated application instance
f_is_misconfigured BOOLEAN, 0 - task is configured correctly and can be executed 1 - task complained about its configuration and will not be executed
f_is_deleted BOOLEAN, if 1 the task will be deleted from the DB next time the TimeService polls this table
f_is_started BOOLEAN, if 1 the task will be started next time the TimeService is polling this table
f_is_stopped BOOLEAN, if 1 the an eventually running task will be stopped next time the TimeService is polling this table
f_is_changed BOOLEAN, a 1 gives a hint to the TimeService that a value in this row or in the respective rows of DOM_TASK_PARAM has changed; the TimeService will then reread the settings for the task and reset this column to 0
lastid NUMBER, 10
 tasks iterating over entities (groups, customers etc.) write the id (groupid, customerid) of the last processed entity into this column
last_last_start TIMESTAMP, timestamp when this task started next to last time
last_start TIMESTAMP, timestamp when this task started last time
last_end TIMESTAMP, timestamp when this task stopped last time
last_change TIMESTAMP, timestamp of the last user change to this task
last_error VARCHAR, 4000
 error message of last failure while running the task.

dom_resource_lock

Contains all lockable resources. In fact, new items are created when used, so it contains only those resources which are currently locked or have been locked in the past.
  • constraint: name:uni_dom_resource_lock_instance
    resource_type, resource_instance, type:UNIQUE
Column Definition Description
lockid NUMBER, 10
pk_resource_lock
PRIMARY KEY
 the unique identifier (primary key) of the lockable resource
resource_type NUMBER, 10
 -1 - not set 1 - lock mail send out 2 - lock user booking 3 - lock system task 4 - lockmeta data creation 5 - lock customer 6 - lock blacklist customer 7 - lock selection 8 - lock group control request 9 - lock scheduled task 10 - lock event rule 11 - lock related data list
resource_instance VARCHAR, 500
 the id of the resource to be locked (e.g. the groupID if the resource is a group)
lock_type NUMBER, 1
 0 - resource is not locked 1 - resource is shared locked 2 - resource is exclusively locked

dom_role_permission

Specifies the permissions for the user roles ( defined in dom_user_role ). Each user has the role specified in dom_user.roleid. The user roles are defined as the rights in the interaction between user and the system. In Java code the used name is CustomerRole. An entry for each possible combination ( customerid, roleid, permissionid ) has to exist here. The field value decides if the role is Granted or Denied. This is the relationship table between DOM_USER_ROLE and DOM_PERMISSION. Each row represents an access control entry (ACE) defining a customer right for a (customer-)role.


  • constraint: name:pk_role_permission
    customerid, roleid, permissionid, type:PRIMARY KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_r_p_ref_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_r_p_ref_role
    references:
    in dom_user_role.roleid for roleid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_r_p_ref_permission
    references:
    in dom_permission.permissionid for permissionid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
roleid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_user_role.roleid
references the role this ACE relates to
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
references the customer this access control entry belongs to
permissionid NUMBER, 4
FK --> dom_permission.permissionid
references the permission this ACE is related to (current range is 100-399 which are the ids for the customer permissions)
value BOOLEAN, 0 - the role does not have the permission 1 - the role has the permission in the group

This is an enumerated type, with the following possible values (See also the DbEncodingUtil class, the mappings live there actually): AAuthor - use the message author's address UUnsubscribe - use unsubscribe address MModerators - replies will go to owners/moderators GGroup - replies will go to the group address OOriginal - don't add any reply-to address, use original if present CCollect - collect replies to the group's mail-box DCollect_including_autoresponses - collect replies to the group's mail-box. Additionally all responses, including also auto-responses are stored in another mail folder FForward - same as Collect, but it also forwards the incoming replies to the specified address HForward_including_autoresponses - same as Forward, but also the auto-responses are stored in another mail folder IIgnore - ignore replies SSpecified - use specified reply-to address for all group mails VEvent - replies trigger an event

This has to do with: If a user has a limit of 3 email in the last week, the dom_user_ext_... will store BOOKPERIOD = 7 , BOOKMAXEMAILCOUNT = 3 The BOOKMAP stores a map of bits for the received emails. BOOKMAPEND stores a date for the oldest message marked in BOOKMAP. So, if BOOKMAPEND is too old, this is ignored. If BOOKMAPEND is, let's say, one week before, the number of bits in BOOKMAP will be count and so we know how many messages the user received in the last week. 0 - maximum message limitation is off 1 - maximum message limitation is on

dom_group_role_permission

See dom_group_permission_override for complete description of the permission checkings algorithm. This table specifies the ''special'' cases when a group role acts different for a group compared to the other customer groups. Here it can be that a group has no entry. This is the relationship table between DOM_GROUP, DOM_MEMBER_ROLE and DOM_PERMISSION. Each row represents an access control entry (ACE) which defines the right on one defined permission for a defined role. In other words, one row describes wheather a certain role has a certain permission in a certain group.

dom_group_permission_override

This table is a bridge between the userroles and grouppermissions. So a given user role ( like admin ) becomes rights to do group-specific operations. The GroupPermission check goes like this: 1. Check in this table if the user with his user role has an entry here. If yes, he got the rights, return Ok. If no continue with step 2. 2. check dom_group_role_permission. Here are only entries makes a group behave different from all other customer groups. The possible situations: * an entry exists with the value 1: Ok, user has the right, return. * an entry exists with the value 0: Deny, the user has NO right, return. * no entry exists: continue with step 3. 3. Check the table dom_group_permission_defaults. Here are entries for each customer, group role and group permission. This entries applies for all customer groups. Based on this value the user will get Ok or Denay. This table contains an entry for each group permission granted to a user role on a system-level basis. So, any user with role ''roleid'' will have the permission identified by ''permissionid'' on all groups belonging to the customer ''customerid''.


  • constraint: name:uni_g_p_o
    customerid, roleid, permissionid, type:PRIMARY KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_g_p_o_ref_customer
    references:
    in dom_customer.customerid for customerid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_g_p_o_ref_role
    references:
    in dom_user_role.roleid for roleid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_g_p_o_ref_permission
    references:
    in dom_permission.permissionid for permissionid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
Column Definition Description
customerid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_customer.customerid
customer to which the permission override applies.
roleid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_user_role.roleid
user role to which the permission override applies.
permissionid NUMBER, 4
check_group_perm_permission1
CHECK
FK --> dom_permission.permissionid
the permission granted by the permission override.

 0 - MAJOR (GROUP): major message sendout 1 - SINGLE (USER): sendout made to a single user 2 - WELCOME: welcome message sendout 3 - SYSTEM: system message sendout
f_new_user BOOLEAN, A flag indicating if received mta response comes from newly added user (recipient) of the system. This happens for example when a group welcome message is sent and bounced.
application VARCHAR, 20
 sets a label (normally a version number) to separate the raw bounces if more than one cluster accesses the DB in parallel.
send_date NEW_TIMESTAMP, timestamp for transactional messages.

dom_member

This is the relationship table between DOM_USER and DOM_GROUP which therefore stores membership information of a certain user in a certain group.
  • constraint: name:fk_member_ref_user
    references:
    in dom_user.userid for userid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_member_ref_group
    references:
    in dom_group.groupid for groupid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:fk_member_ref_role
    references:
    in dom_member_role.roleid for roleid,
    type:FOREIGN KEY
  • constraint: name:pk_member
    groupid, userid, type:PRIMARY KEY
  • constraint: name:chk_bounce_cols
    type:CHECK
Column Definition Description
userid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_user.userid
references the user that is member
groupid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_group.groupid
references the group the user is member in
type CHAR, 1
 o - owner m - moderator n - member a - aspirant (moderated) p - pending (invited) x - pending aspirant (invited & moderated) i - pending import (marked for deletion during import)
roleid NUMBER, 10
FK --> dom_member_role.roleid
references the role the user has in the group
bounced_since TIMESTAMP, NULL - user has regular (not bounced) status any date - user is set to 'bounced'-status since that date
msgformat CHAR, 3
 This 3 character field has the following format: CH1CH2CH3 Where each character means the message format for: CH1 - the email channel; CH2 - the SMS channel; CH3 - the fax channel; Each of the characters determines the preferences for it's respective channel: Character typeMeaning blankchannel not desired by the user (there will be no message delivered on this channel) upper casepreferred channel (always send on this channel if available) lower caseallowed channel (only send on this channel if no other channel available) The character itself designates the preferred format for each channel. Each character can be lower or upper case (see above). In the tables below only the upper case variant is listed. All channels: A - any format accepted (no preference) Email channel: H - html mail R - rich-media mail M - HTML multipart mail T - text mail X - rich-media multipart U - unknown (incoming group messages) SMS channel: S - SMS F - flash SMS Fax channel: P - fax For no delivery, the field will be set to '   ' (3 spaces).
created TIMESTAMP, the timestamp when this membership was inserted into the table
bounce_category NUMBER, 1
 -1 - Complaint: user complains about being spammed 0 - INVALID: domain or mailserver does not exist/cannot be reached 1 - TRANSIENT: temporary error (mailbox full, etc.) 2 - BLOCKED: mail is blocked 3 - REJECTED: mailserver does not accept the mail/user 4 - UNKNOWN: cannot be determined
deactivation_category NUMBER, 1
 Reponse category (based on NEW categorisation - NewResponseCategory class) which a member was deactivated by
bounce_counter NUMBER, 2
 number of bounces that were received for this member; if a member gets unbounced (reactivated) this value is reset to 0 again
message_counter NUMBER, 5
 number of messages that were received for this member

pending BOOLEAN, This flag is set by a blacklist import with "replace" sync mode. Initially all blacklist entries (for the import's ustomer/group) will be set to "pending=true". Then the "pending" flag will be set to false as the entries are imported from the file. At the end all remaining "pending=true" entries are deleted.

dom_reader_tracking

Used for recording HTTP requests from user-tracking-aware HTML mails. One row in this table represents the fact that one specific user has read one specific message. Only the first read of a user is recorded in this table. This means, when a user reads a message for the second time, no further row is inserted in this table.


  • constraint: name:pk_reader_tracking
    messageid, userid, type:PRIMARY KEY
Column Definition Description
userid NUMBER, 10
 references the user that received the HTML-email
messageid NUMBER, 10
 references the email-message itself
sample_date TIMESTAMP, date of insertion, which is the first time that the user reads the message


dom_reader_tracking_cnt

Counts all reads of one message within one hour. The counting is user independent. This means any read from any user for this specific message within the specific hour is counted, even if one user reads the message several times.


  • constraint: name:pk_reader_tracking_cnt
    messageid, hour, type:PRIMARY KEY
Column Definition Description
messageid NUMBER, 10
 references the email-message itself
hour TIMESTAMP, begin of the hour period
no_of_reads NUMBER, 7
 counter for the number of reads within the specified hour. If one user opens a message two times, here it will be counted also two times.
no_of_first_reads NUMBER, 7
 counter for the number of users that opened the message for the first time within the specified hour. This number is unique per user, so if one user reads one message two times on different hours, he will be counted only for the first hour.


dom_reader_tracking_temp

Temporary store for incoming reader trackings. Data will be processed later and is written to DOM_READER_TRACKING, DOM_READER_TRACKING_CNT and DOM_MESSAGE. After processing data is deleted.


Column Definition Description
userid NUMBER, 10
 references the user that received the HTML-email
messageid NUMBER, 10
 references the email-message itself
sendoutdate NEW_TIMESTAMP, the sendout date, for transactional messages
sample_date TIMESTAMP, date of insertion, which is the first time that the user reads the message

Column Definition Description

 references the user who is associated with the transaction

dom_job_store

Contains jobs in form of serialized Java-objects. Here you find all jobs in the system which are not supposed to be executed immediately (scheduled, delayed, failed and parked jobs).

dom_pk_job_store
PRIMARY KEY
 unique identifier of the job

 references the customer the job belongs to

 references the scheduled task the job has been created from

 contains Java class name (no package) of the job's class
status CHAR, 1
 The status of the job p - parked d- delayed s - scheduled f - failed r - ready x - processing i - invalid
priority NUMBER, 1
 priority of the job 9 - high 4 - normal

scheduled_date TIMESTAMP, time when job is supposed to be executed

 human readable information about the parameters of the job

 sets a label (normally a version number) to separate the jobs if several different systems (applications) access the DB in parallel
server_name VARCHAR, 40
 contains name of the server that currently processes this job.
thread_name VARCHAR, 40
 contains name of the thread that currently processes this job.

processing_start_timestamp TIMESTAMP, this column is set when the job is in status PROCESSING and contains the timestamp when the processing started
last_status_change_date TIMESTAMP, time when job status was last changed
origin VARCHAR, 200
 origin of the entity
root_origin VARCHAR, 200
 root origin of the entity
orderid VARCHAR, 50
 unique identifier of selection running for this job on selection-engine
job BYTE, the serialized job as a BLOB

dom_message_rcpt_stats

During the sendout, for each tracked user will be counted some statistic data. For example, by defo will be computed : 1. for readers: a ) per title the count b ) per age the count c ) + two attributes which can be choosed from a list 2. for click-tracking a )...c) same as for 1. 3. for shop-tracking a )...c) same as for 1. This counters will be immediately available for use in web. Contains data used for target group analysis of a message. Every row belongs to a message (messageid) and contains counters for recipients, openers, clickers etc that have a certain value combination of some predefined attribute. So there are several rows for a message one for each occurring value permutation. For example if there are two user attributes considered for the statistics, gender (3 possible values) and hair color (5 possible values), there could be at most 15 rows for one message.


Column Definition Description
id NUMBER, 12
pk_messagercptstatsid
PRIMARY KEY
 primary key.
messageid NUMBER, 10
 the related message id
age_category CHAR, 1
 the user's age category the statistics are cumulated for; allowed values are capital characters from A" to "F" or NULL
title NUMBER, 1
 the user's gender the statistics are cumulated for; 1=Mr. 2=Mrs NULL=unset
named_attribute_value1 VARCHAR, 500
 the value of the first named attribute that is considered for stats
named_attribute_value2 VARCHAR, 500
 the value of the second named attribute that is considered for stats
recipient_cnt NUMBER, 10
 the number of recipients for the value combination
reader_cnt NUMBER, 10
 the number of readers for the value combination
clicker_cnt NUMBER, 10
 the number of clickers for the value combination
shopper_cnt NUMBER, 10
 the number of shoppers for the value combination


dom_message_rcpt_stats_temp

 The time zone of the rule.

execution_days CHAR, 7
 defines at which days the rule is executed. Every character stands for on day of the week, the leftmost character stands for monday the rightmost character for sunday. If the character contains an 'x' the task possibly fires that day, if the character contains an 'o' the rule will not fire at that day of week. Example: 'ooxoxoo' means rule will only fire on wednesdays and fridays.

 references the automationplan version the event rule corresponds to

 priority of the event rule. The bigger value the lower priority. If RawEvent matches more than 1 EventRule, only the one with highest priority will get generated Event In case all matched EventRules have priority set to null, all EventRules will get generated Event Intention to use in Interaction Planner for goal event prioritization 1 - highest NULL - lowest
on_best_time BOOLEAN, if true/1 the rule is executed on best possible time based on AI

references the group category of all involved groups

 number of latest groups to consider
